title.narrative: TP 1 Peaceful co-existence

description.narrative: Promote a more peaceful and resilient society with respect for human rights

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: 2.1 - Empowerment scheme co-created with Malian stakeholders
Empowerment scheme developed in coordination with local partners; scheme to address aspects of mediation, conflict analysis and perspectives of young Malian leaders.

target.value: 15 mentoring schemes implemented with identified youth leaders

actual.value: 15 mentoring schemes implemented with identified youth leaders in October 2020

target.value: 15 youth leaders identified after empowerment meetings to partake in mentoring scheme.

actual.value: 19 youths have been identified as mentees (on a voluntary basis) and 27 potential mentors have been identified and are currently being contacted to explore their availability.

target.value: No target

title.narrative: 5.2 - Actors’ capacity strengthened to spread peaceful messages through local communication channels

Capacity to elaborate and spread peaceful messages increased (Qualitative: Youth indicated strengthened capacity to spread peaceful messages, e.g. knowing message, targeted marketing strategy, channels)

target.value: Main communication channels for youth identified; strategies identified to promote messages shared among youth in different communities
No target
Increased capacity to identify and tailor message to relevant target audience; messages elaborated and spread by young leaders on different media platforms

title.narrative: 1.3 - ToT for prison personnel to teach colleagues how to use risk assessment tool.

target.value:
At least 30 colleagues trained in use of risk assessment tool within the national Malian prison system (august)
60 risk assessments of VEOs conducted by trained colleagues.

actual.value:
At least 30 colleagues trained in use of risk assessment tool within the national Malian prison system (august 2020)
60 risk assessments of VEOs conducted by trained colleagues./October 2020

target.value: No target
At least 15 prison staff trained in teaching colleagues on how to use the tool.

actual.value: Trained 15 DNAPES prison staff. In addition. 2 representatives from MINUSMA/JCS and 2 representatives Think Peace participated in the training leading.

title.narrative: 2.2 - Meetings held to empower youth leaders with tools in non-violent discourse

Empowerment meetings held with Malian youth leaders on non-violent discourse
(Quantitative: Number of youth whom meetings were held with; increase in knowledge on non-violent discourse as tested through pre-/post-meeting questionnaire and/or interviews)

target.value: 75 youth participated in empowerment meetings. 75% indicate increase in knowledge on non-violent discourse.
No target.

title.narrative: 2.3 - Mentoring scheme set up

One-on-one mentoring scheme for youth leaders set up
(Quantitative: number of youth leaders being mentored; number of youth reached through youth leader mentees)

target.value: Mentoring scheme set up. 15 youth trained by mentors; these mentees to reach out to at least 30 youth.

actual.value: Have developed the concept of the mentoring which details the aim and structure of the mentoring program. as well as 1 guide for mentor and 1 guide for mentees to facilitate their first meeting.

target.value: No target.

title.narrative: 3.1 - Mid-term evaluation report
Submission of mid-term evaluation report to Danish Embassy

target.value:
Preparations for mid-term report and evaluation mission initiated. including plan for collection of primary data
Mid-term evaluation report submitted and findings used to refine ongoing activities

actual.value: Mid-term evaluation not received as of 4 October 2019.

target.value: No target.

title.narrative: 3.2 - Final evaluation report
Submission of final evaluation report to Danish Embassy

target.value: Final evaluation report submitted. detailing impact and effectiveness of project. providing recommendations for future activities

actual.value: Final evaluation report submitted. detailing impact and effectiveness of project. providing recommendations for future activities/October 2020

target.value: No target.
No target.

title.narrative: 4.1 - Summary analysis of interviews with young leaders (outside the prison context) to assess impact of terrorism on youth
Number of interviews with young leaders analysed

target.value: Interviews conducted with 20 individual youth leaders.

actual.value: Interviews conducted with 20 individual youth leaders in October 2020

target.value: No target.
Interview methodology (semi-structure interviews) developed.

title.narrative: 1.1 - Finalisation of risk assessment tool resulting from training session with prison personnel.

target.value:
- Further sharing of knowledge on risk evaluation leading to wider usage of risk assessment tool. more accurate classification of VEOs
-Final (further refined) risk assessment ready and submitted to DNAPES

actual.value:
- Further sharing of knowledge on risk evaluation leading to wider usage of risk assessment tool. more accurate classification of VEOs/August 2020
-Final (further refined) risk assessment ready and submitted to DNAPES/October 2020

target.value: No target.
Risk assessment tool finalised.

actual.value: Risk assessment tool finalised in May 2019.

title.narrative: 1.2 - Pilot testing of the tool in two Malian prisons (MCA and Koulikoro)

- Number of pilot assessments conducted;
- Qualitative interviews with implementers indicating that tool was verified or adjusted for implementation

target.value:
-Tested tool implemented in the Malian national penitentiary system
- Tested tool continues to be implemented

actual.value: -Tested tool implemented in the Malian national penitentiary system in August 2020

target.value: No target.
Tool tested in two prisons by trained prison staff.

actual.value: Tool tested in MCA and Koulikoro.

title.narrative: 2 B - Youth empowered to promote alternative narratives through mentoring
Youth engaged in alternative narrative mentoring scheme (Quantitative: number of trained mentors indicating increased capacity to promote alterative narratives)

target.value:
- 15 youth leaders trained and spreading alternative narratives on non-violent political discourse through mentoring scheme.
- 30 youth reached by mentees

title.narrative: 5 A & B - Youth engaged in promoting alternatives to violence inside and outside prisons
Youth are engaged in spreading alternative messages inside and outside prisons (Quantitative; size of audience receiving youth-driven peaceful messaging inside and outside prisons)

target.value: 30 individuals reached through alternative narrative scheme both inside and outside prison

title.narrative: 3 A & B - Programme effectiveness and impact is assessed through evaluations, fed back into programming and informs wider stakeholder community

Mid-term and final evaluation reports submitted to Danish Embassy, based on three-pronged evaluation methodology (impact, programme and process assessments), also providing recommendations for future activities and the wider stakeholder community.

target.value: Final evaluation report showing evidence of project’s effectiveness and impact. using three-pronged evaluation methodology. Recommendations for future activities and wider stakeholder community provided. Qualitative evidence of 50 stakeholders gathered.

title.narrative: 4 A & B - Increased understanding on the impact of terrorism on youth

Research report based on primary data, using two-staged approach (qualitative data through interviews with youth leaders, findings tested and confirmed through questionnaires.
Remark: In September 2019, the Embassy accepted a proposal from ICCT-UNICRI to widen the scope so that it would also take into account criminal groups other than terrorist organizations as this had been raised by several beneficiaries of the project. The Embassy underlined that the research should still take into account nuances/differences when dealing specifically with terrorist organizations such as the religious/ideological component.

target.value: Measurable understanding on impact of violent extremist groups on youth in north and central parts of the country as evidenced through primary data that has been tested and verified

title.narrative: 1 A - Trained prison staff conduct risk assessment and classification of VEOs
Risk assessment and classification are conducted for inmates in Malian prisons (Quantitative factor: number of risk assessments/classifications conducted)

target.value: Trained prison staff conduct and use risk assessment and classification of VEOs. data on VEOs available and opportunities identified for rehabilitation & reintegration purposes.

title.narrative: MERIT Mali (Dis) Engagement and (Re) Integration related to Terrorism
Trained prison staff conduct risk assessment and classification of VEOs

target.value: trained prison staff conduct and use risk assessment and classification of VEOs. data on VEOs available and opportunities identified for rehabilitation & reintegration purposes

title.narrative: 5.1 - Dialogue session on non-violent political discourse between youth leaders and detained VEOs
Report of dialogue session indicating engagement on non-violent alternatives (Quantitative indicator: 5 VEOs engaged in non-violent dialogue session)
4.2 - Testing of results from interviews among youth in central and northern Mali
Questionnaire developed. (Quantitative: Number of completed questionnaires)
